Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\web\HttpCache

All Classes | Properties | Methods
Inheritanceyii\web\HttpCache » yii\base\ActionFilter » yii\base\Behavior » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable
Available since version2.0
Source Code
The HttpCache provides functionality for caching via HTTP Last-Modified and Etag headers.

It is an action filter that can be added to a controller and handles the beforeAction event.

To use AccessControl, declare it in the behaviors() method of your controller class. In the following example the filter will be applied to the list-action and the Last-Modified header will contain the date of the last update to the user table in the database.

public function behaviors()
{
    return [
        'httpCache' => [
            'class' => \yii\web\HttpCache::className(),
            'only' => ['list'],
            'lastModified' => function ($action, $params) {
                $q = new Query();
                return strtotime($q->from('users')->max('updated_timestamp'));
            },
//            'etagSeed' => function ($action, $params) {
//                return // generate etag seed here
//            }
        ],
    ];
}

Property Details

$lastModified property
callback $lastModified = null

A PHP callback that returns the UNIX timestamp of the last modification time. The callback's signature should be:

function ($action, $params)

where $action is the yii\base\Action object that this filter is currently handling; $params takes the value of $params. The callback should return a UNIX timestamp.

$etagSeed property
callback $etagSeed = null

A PHP callback that generates the Etag seed string. The callback's signature should be:

function ($action, $params)

where $action is the yii\base\Action object that this filter is currently handling; $params takes the value of $params. The callback should return a string serving as the seed for generating an Etag.

$params property
mixed $params = null

Additional parameters that should be passed to the $lastModified and $etagSeed callbacks.

$cacheControlHeader property
string $cacheControlHeader = 'max-age=3600, public'

HTTP cache control header. If null, the header will not be sent.

Method Details

beforeAction() method
boolean beforeAction( $action )
$action yii\base\Action The action to be executed.
return boolean whether the action should continue to be executed.

This method is invoked right before an action is to be executed (after all possible filters.) You may override this method to do last-minute preparation for the action.

validateCache() method
boolean validateCache( $lastModified, $etag )
$lastModified integer The calculated Last-Modified value in terms of a UNIX timestamp. If null, the Last-Modified header will not be validated.
$etag string The calculated ETag value. If null, the ETag header will not be validated.
return boolean whether the HTTP cache is still valid.

Validates if the HTTP cache contains valid content.

sendCacheControlHeader() method
void sendCacheControlHeader( )

Sends the cache control header to the client

See Also

generateEtag() method
string generateEtag( $seed )
$seed string Seed for the ETag
return string the generated Etag

Generates an Etag from the given seed string.
